place.name: THORNHAUGH
place.gazetteerText: THORNHAUGH, a parish in the district of Stamford and county of Northampton; 1¼ mile NNW of Wansford-Road r. station. Post town, Wansford. Acres, 1,706. Real property, £2,031. Pop., 243. Houses, 50. The property belongs to the Duke of Bedford. The living is a rectory, united with Wansford, in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £483.* Patron, the Duke of Bedford. The church is ancient. There is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
